sub_topic: Determine the symmetries of a manifold.
message_1: Let M be a 2-dimensional manifold represented as a surface of revolution generated by rotating the curve given by y = x^2/4 about the x-axis. Determine the number of rotational symmetries that M possesses.
message_2:
A rotational symmetry is a transformation that rotates an object around an axis such that the object remains unchanged after the rotation. In this case, we are considering the surface of revolution M generated by rotating the curve y = x^2/4 about the x-axis.

Since M is a surface of revolution, it is symmetric about the x-axis. This means that any rotation around the x-axis will result in the same surface. Therefore, M has an infinite number of rotational symmetries around the x-axis.
